Function for Reunification Held in S. Korea
articles.content:
Function for Reunification Held in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The Inchon Headquarters of the Movement for Reunified Korean Nation in south Korea reportedly held a north-made film festival at a theatre before Puphyong Railway Station in Inchon on June 30 and July 1.
 Korean feature films "A Bellflower", "Three Girls on the Solhan Ridge", "Two Families in Haeun-dong", "Ye Youth" and so on were screened at the festival.    
 Meanwhile, a north photo exhibition was opened in front of the theatre.

DPRK Friendship Delegation to Visit China
articles.content:
DPRK Friendship Delegation to Visit China
   Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- A DPRK friendship delegation led by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, will soon pay an official goodwill visit to the People's Republic of China at the invitation of the PRC government. It will participate in the celebrations of the 45th anniversary of the treaty of DPRK-China friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance.

articles.title: Greetings to Rwandan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Rwandan President
   Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on June 28 sent a message of greetings to Rwandan President Paul Kagame on the occasion of its national day. 
 Kim in the message wished the president and people of Rwanda greater success in their work to consolidate the national unity and achieve economic development and expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the mutual interests.

articles.title: Greetings to Venezuelan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Venezuelan President
   Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez Frias on the occasion of the day of its independence. 
 The message reaffirmed the DPRK's full support and solidarity with the president and people of Venezuela in their efforts to resolutely defend the Bolivarian revolution from the U.S. attempt for interference and aggression and expressed the belief that bonds of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in the future.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Verde Cape
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Verde Cape
   Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to President of Verde Cape Pedro Pires on the occasion of the 31st anniversary of its independence and proclamation of the republic.
 In the message Kim extended warm congratulations to the president, government and people of Verde Cape and sincerely wished its people new progress and welfare, expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop in mutual interests in the future.

articles.title: Congratulations to PM and FM of Iceland
articles.content:
Congratulations to PM and FM of Iceland
   Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a congratulatory message to Geir Haarde on his assumption of office as prime minister of the Republic of Iceland.
 The message warmly congratulated the prime minister, wishing him great success in his responsible work in the future.    
 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar congratulatory message to Valgedur Sverrisdotir on the appointment as foreign minister of Iceland.

articles.title: Berkeley University of California Professor and His Party Arrive Here
articles.content:
Berkeley University of California Professor and His Party Arrive Here
   Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Professor of Government Emeritus of Berkeley University of California in the United States Robert A. Scalapino and his party arrived here Tuesday.

articles.title: Protocol and Agreement between Governments of DPRK and Belarus Signed
articles.content:
Protocol and Agreement between Governments of DPRK and Belarus Signed
   Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- A protocol on the 2nd meeting of the joint committee for trade and economic cooperation and an agreement on the avoidance of double taxation on income and property between the governments of the DPRK and Belarus were signed in Minsk on June 30.   
 The protocol was inked by Jo Jong Ho, vice-minister of Foreign Trade who was heading the DPRK government economic delegation, and Viktar Gaisenak, deputy minister of Foreign Affairs of Belarus.    
 The agreement was signed by Jo and Anna Deico, minister of Tax Collection of Belarus.
